title: Diagnostic suggests PartialOrd change that clippy denies by default

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
Given the [following code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=8f36d9431f2e7a23ed5c36b4bb7458c0):

```rust
#[derive(PartialEq, Eq)]
struct LineEndpoint {
    x: i64,
    y: i64,
    start: bool,
}

impl Ord for LineEndpoint {
    fn cmp(&self, _other: &Self) -> std::cmp::Ordering {
        todo!()
    }
}
```

The current output is:
```
error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): can't compare `LineEndpoint` with `LineEndpoint`
 --> src/lib.rs:8:6
  |
8 | impl Ord for LineEndpoint {
  |      ^^^ no implementation for `LineEndpoint < LineEndpoint` and `LineEndpoint > LineEndpoint`
  |
  = help: the trait `PartialOrd` is not implemented for `LineEndpoint`
note: required by a bound in `Ord`
help: consider annotating `LineEndpoint` with `#[derive(PartialOrd)]`
  |
2 | #[derive(PartialOrd)]
  |
```

However, adding `#[derive(PartialOrd)]` as the diagnostic suggested [results in a clippy lint](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=61120ef9c2a61c3aedd5ca8ea1853a19) that is `deny` by default:
```rust
#[derive(PartialOrd, PartialEq, Eq)]
struct LineEndpoint {
    x: i64,
    y: i64,
    start: bool,
}

impl Ord for LineEndpoint {
    fn cmp(&self, _other: &Self) -> std::cmp::Ordering {
        todo!()
    }
}
```

Clippy output:
```
error: you are implementing `Ord` explicitly but have derived `PartialOrd`
  --> src/lib.rs:8:1
   |
8  | / impl Ord for LineEndpoint {
9  | |     fn cmp(&self, _other: &Self) -> std::cmp::Ordering {
10 | |         todo!()
11 | |     }
12 | | }
   | |_^
   |
note: `PartialOrd` implemented here
  --> src/lib.rs:1:10
   |
1  | #[derive(PartialOrd, PartialEq, Eq)]
   |          ^^^^^^^^^^
   = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#derive_ord_xor_partial_ord
   = note: `#[deny(clippy::derive_ord_xor_partial_ord)]` on by default
   = note: this error originates in the derive macro `PartialOrd` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
```

The suggested change in the diagnostic is substantially the same across the current stable, beta, and nightly releases.

I don't have a concrete suggestion for what the compiler's diagnostic should be instead. I just found it surprising that the compiler's suggestion triggers a clippy lint.
